QRegExp m_regexp

Detailed Description

A validator for string values.

This class is used to check a string against a regular expression.

Member Enumeration Documentation

enum TValueValidator::EValidateResult [inherited]

Enumerator:
VR_BAD  means that validation has failed.
VR_OK  means that validation has passed.
VR_FIXED  means that validated value has corrected automatically during validation.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

TRegExpValidator::TRegExpValidator ( QRegExp &  regexp,
QObject *  parent = 0 
)

Constructor.

Parameters:
regexp is regular expression used to validate the value.

Member Function Documentation

virtual EValidateResult TRegExpValidator::checkValue ( QVariant &  value  )  [virtual]

Validates a "value" normally passed from item editor. If the value does not match given regular expression, the validation will fail. If the value matches the regular expression (or regular expression is invalid), the validation is ok.

See also:
regexp(), setRegExp()

Implements TValueValidator.

Returns regular expression.
